item.name: cpqDa6AccelBadDataTrap
item.description:
Cache Module Board Bad Data. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a cache module board that has lost backup power. If data was being stored in the cache module memory when the server lost power, that data has been lost. The backup power source is indicated by cpqDaAccelBackupPowerSource.
User Action: Verify that no data has been lost.

item.name: cpqDa6AccelBatteryFailed
item.description:
Cache Module Board Backup Power Source Failed. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a backup power source failure associated with the cache module board. The backup power source is indicated by cpqDaAccelBackupPowerSource.
User Action: Replace the Backup Power Source.

item.name: cpqDa6AccelStatusChange
item.description:
Cache Module Board Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of a cache module board. The current status is represented by the variable cpqDaAccelStatus.
User Action:
If cpqDaAccelStatus is 'permDisabled(5)', you may need to replace the cache module board.
If cpqDaAccelStatus is 'cacheModFlashMemNotAttached(6)', install the flash memory.

item.name: cpqDa6CntlrStatusChange
item.description:
Controller Status Change.
This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of a drive array controller. The variable cpqDaCntlrBoardStatus indicates the current controller status.
User Action:
If cpqDaCntlrBoardStatus is 'generalFailure(3)', you may need to reboot the server or replace the controller. After the system is rebooted, check the variable cpqDaCntlrLastLockupCode for the controller<92>s last lockup code.
If cpqDaCntlrBoardStatus is 'cableProblem(4)', check the cable connections between the controller and the storage system.
If cpqDaCntlrBoardStatus is 'cacheModuleMissing(6)', the array controller is operating in an unsupported configuration and requires that a cache module be attached to the controller.

item.name: cpqDa6LogDrvStatusChange
item.description: Logical Drive Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of a drive array logical drive. The variable cpqDaLogDrvStatus indicates the current logical drive status.

item.name: cpqDa7PhyDrvStatusChange
item.description:
Physical Drive Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of a drive array physical drive. The variable cpaDaPhyDrvStatus indicates the current physical drive status.
User Action: If cpaDaPhyDrvStatus is 'failed(3)', 'predictiveFailure(4)', 'ssdWearOut(8)', or 'notAuthenticated(9)', replace the drive.

item.name: cpqDa7SpareStatusChange
item.description: Spare Drive Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of a drive array spare drive. The variable cpqDaSpareStatus indicates the current spare drive status. User Action: If cpqDaSpareStatus is 'failed(3)', replace the drive.

item.name: cpqDaPhyDrvSSDWearStatusChange
item.description: Solid State Disk Wear Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the SSD wear status of a drive array physical drive. The variable cpqDaPhyDrvSSDWearStatus indicates the current SSD wear status. User Action: If cpqDaPhyDrvSSDWearStatus is 'ssdWearOut(6)', replace the drive.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanDegraded
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Fan condition has been set to degraded for the specified chassis and fan.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanFailed
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Fan condition has been set to failed for the specified chassis and fan.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanInserted
item.description: A Fault Tolerant Fan has been inserted into the specified chassis and fan location.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanRedundancyLost
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Fans have lost redundancy for the specified chassis.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanRedundancyRestored
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Fans have returned to a redundant state for the specified chassis.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolFanRemoved
item.description: A Fault Tolerant Fan has been removed from the specified chassis and fan location.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolPowerRedundancyLost
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Power Supplies have lost redundancy for the specified chassis.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolPowerRedundancyRestored
item.description: The Fault Tolerant Power Supplies have returned to a redundant state for the specified chassis.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolPowerSupplyInserted
item.description: A Fault Tolerant Power Supply has been inserted into the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe3FltTolPowerSupplyRemoved
item.description: A Fault Tolerant Power Supply has been removed from the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe3PostError
item.description: One or more POST errors occurred. Power On Self-Test (POST) errors occur during the server restart process. Details of the POST error messages can be found in Integrated Management Log.

item.name: cpqHe3TemperatureDegraded
item.description: The temperature status has been set to degraded in the specified chassis and location. The server's temperature is outside of the normal operating range. The server will be shutdown if the cpqHeThermalDegradedAction variable is set to shutdown(3)

item.name: cpqHe3TemperatureOk
item.description: The temperature status has been set to ok in the specified chassis and location. The server's temperature has returned to the normal operating range.

item.name: cpqHe3ThermalConfirmation
item.description: The server has previously been shutdown due to a thermal anomaly on the server and has just become operational again.

item.name: cpqHe4FltTolPowerSupplyACpowerloss
item.description: The fault tolerant power supply AC power loss for the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe4FltTolPowerSupplyDegraded
item.description: The fault tolerant power supply condition has been set to degraded for the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe4FltTolPowerSupplyFailed
item.description: The fault tolerant power supply condition has been set to failed for the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe4FltTolPowerSupplyOk
item.description: The fault tolerant power supply condition has been set back to the OK state for the specified chassis and bay location.

item.name: cpqHe5CorrMemReplaceMemModule
item.description: Corrected \ uncorrected Memory Errors Detected. The errors have been corrected, but the memory module should be replaced. Value 0 for CPU means memory is not Processor based.

item.name: cpqHeResilientMemMirroredMemoryEngaged
item.description: Advanced Memory Protection Mirrored Memory Engaged. The Advanced Memory Protection subsystem has detected a memory fault. Mirrored Memory has been activated. User Action: Replace the faulty memory.

item.name: cpqHo2GenericTrap
item.description: Generic trap.

item.name: cpqHo2PowerThresholdTrap
item.description: Power threshold exceeded.

item.name: cpqHoMibHealthStatusArrayChangeTrap
item.description: A change in the cpqHoMibHealthStatusArray has occurred.

item.name: cpqIdeAtaDiskStatusChange
item.description:
ATA Disk Status Change. This trap signifies that the agent has detected a change in the status of an ATA disk drive. The variable cpqIdeAtaDiskStatus indicates the current disk drive status.
User Action: If cpqIdeAtaDiskStatus is 'smartError(3)', 'failed(4)' or 'ssdWearOut(5)' replace the drive.

item.name: cpqNic3ConnectivityLost
item.description:
This trap will be sent any time the status of a logical adapter changes to the Failed condition. This occurs when the adapter in a single adapter configuration fails, or when the last adapter in a redundant configuration fails. This can be caused by loss of link due to a cable being removed from the adapter or the Hub or Switch. Internal adapter, Hub, or Switch failures can also cause this condition.
User Action: Check the cables to the adapter and the Hub or Switch. If no cable problems are found, the adapter, Hub, or Switch may need replacement.

item.name: cpqNic3ConnectivityRestored
item.description:
This trap will be sent any time connectivity is restored to a logical adapter. This occurs when the physical adapter in a single adapter configuration returns to the OK condition or at least one physical adapter in a logical adapter group returns to the OK condition. This can be caused by replacement of a faulty cable or re-attaching a cable that was unplugged.
User Action: None required.

item.name: cpqSasPhyDrvStatusChange
item.description:
Physical Drive Status Change. The Storage Agent has detected a change in the status of a SAS or SATA physical drive. The current physical drive status is indicated in the cpqSasPhyDrvStatus variable.
User Action: If cpqSasPhyDrvStatus is 'predictiveFailure(3)', 12 'failed(5)', 'ssdWearOut(10)' or 'notAuthenticated(12)', replace the drive.

item.name: cpqSm2SecurityOverrideDisengaged
item.description: Security Override Disengaged. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the disengaged position.

item.name: cpqSm2SecurityOverrideEngaged
item.description: Security Override Engaged. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the engaged position.

item.name: cpqSm2SelfTestError
item.description: Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out Self Test Error. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected a Remote Insight self test error.

item.name: cpqSm2ServerPowerOff
item.description: The server has been powered off. This will be sent once the server has been powered off, either by OS, or the power button.

item.name: cpqSm2ServerPowerOn
item.description: The server has been powered on. This will be sent once a server power on transition has occurred.

item.name: cpqSm2ServerPowerOnFailure
item.description: A request was made to power on the server, however the server could not be powered on due to a failure condition.

item.name: cpqSm2ServerReset
item.description: Server Reset Detected. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected a server reset.

item.name: cpqSm2UnauthorizedLoginAttempts
item.description: Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out Unauthorized Login Attempts. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected unauthorized login attempts.

trigger.name: Integrated Lights-Out Self Test Error.
trigger.description: Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out Self Test Error. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected a Remote Insight self test error.

trigger.name: Security Override Disengaged
trigger.description: Security Override Disengaged. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the disengaged position.

trigger.name: Security Override Engaged
trigger.description: Security Override Engaged. The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the engaged position.

trigger.name: Server could not be powered on due to a failure condition
trigger.description: A request was made to power on the server, however the server could not be powered on due to a failure condition.

trigger.name: Server powered off
trigger.description: The server has been powered off. This will be sent once the server has been powered off, either by OS, or the power button.

trigger.name: Server powered on
trigger.description: The server has been powered on. This will be sent once a server power on transition has occurred.

trigger.name: Unauthorized Login Attempts
trigger.description: The Remote Insight/ Integrated Lights-Out firmware has detected unauthorized login attempts.
